titlStmt.titl: CCRI 1931 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1931 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique

citation.biblCit: Gaffield, Chad; Baskerville, Peter; St-Hilaire, Marc; Amrhein, Carl; Cadigan, Sean; Moldofsky, Byron; Darroch, Gordon; Bellavance, Claude; Normand, France, 2015, "CCRI 1931 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1931 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10452, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: CCRI 1931 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1931 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique

stdyInfo.abstract: This study includes two components of the research infrastructure developed by CCRI for the 1931 Census of Canada: selected digitized published tables of aggregate data and a reconstruction of the census geography.

useStmt.disclaimer: Geographic files adapted from Statistics Canada, Census Subdivisions Cartographic Boundary File, 2001 Census, Second Edition, 2002. This does not constitute an endorsement by Statistics Canada of this product.

othrStdyMat.relStdy: See also the CCRI Census of Canada materials for 1911, 1921, 1941 and 1951.
othrStdyMat.othRefs: Marc St-Hilaire , Byron Moldofsky , Laurent Richard & Mariange Beaudry (2007): Geocoding and Mapping Historical Census Data: The Geographical Component of the Canadian Century Research Infrastructure, Historical Methods: A Journal of Quantitative and Interdisciplinary History, 40:2, 76-91. http://dx.doi.org/10.3200/HMTS.40.2.76-91

otherMat.txt: ESRI metadata in .pdf format for the 1931 Census division (CD) polygon files.
ESRI metadata in .pdf format for the 1931 Census subdivision (CSD) polygon files.
Summary of all tables from the 1911 to 1951 censuses digitized by the CCRI.

Table: 1931, Vol. 2, Table 21. Title: Population, Canadian, British and Foreign born, classified by sex, for municipalities, townships or other subdivisions, 1931. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1931. Seventh Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 2, Table 21, pp. 164-249. Basic unit of Geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).

Table: 1931, Vol. 2, Table 33. Title: Population classified according to principal origins for municipalities, etc., 1931. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1931. Seventh Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 2, Table 33, pp. 320-493. Basic unit of Geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).

Table: 1931, Vol. 2, Table 42. Title: Population classified according to principal religions for municipalities, etc., 1931. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1931. Seventh Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 2, Table 42, pp. 534-696. Basic unit of Geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).

Table: 1931, Vol. 5, Table 49. Title: Buildings (containing dwellings), dwellings and households, classified as rural and urban, for counties and census divisions, 1931. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1931. Seventh Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 5, Table 49, pp. 944-949. Basic unit of Geography: Census district (CD).

Boundary polygon files in ESRI "shape file" format that reconstruct the census compilation and dissemination geography for the 1931 at the Census division (CD) level of geography. A NAP metadata record in .xml format is included.

Boundary polygon files in ESRI "shape file" format that reconstruct the census compilation and dissemination geography for the 1931 Census at the Census subdivision (CSD) level of geography. A NAP metadata record in .xml format is included.
Excerpts from the CCRI User Guide relevant to the geographic and aggregate data components of the CCRI.
Extraits du guide d'usage de l'IRCS reliés aux éléments du c​adre géographique et de l'ensemble de données agrégées de l'IRCS.
Sommaire de tous les tableaux des recensements de 1911 à 1951 numérisés par l'IRCS.
A collection of maps in .pdf format detailing the 1931 census geography for each province.
